newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Consumer prices up 0.3 percent in December.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Consumer prices up 0.3 percent in December.

text.p: Consumer prices in December edged higher as inflation for all of 1996 rose at the fastest rate in six years, the Labor Department said on Tuesday.

The Department said the consumer price index rose 0.3 percent in December, identical with November's rise. However, with the often-volatile food and energy sector removed, the so-called core rate increased more modestly, rising only 0.1 percent after being up 0.2 percent in November.
